meanings.sent1: She experienced premenstrual symptoms every month.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the premenstrual phase is a normal part of the menstrual cycle.
meanings.sent3: Her premenstrual mood swings made her cat think she was a different person.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the air was premenstrual, signaling the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The premenstrual bloating felt like carrying a watermelon in her belly.

meanings.definition: Relating to the time before menstruation.
meanings.sent1: The premenstrual period can vary in length for different women.
meanings.sent2: She always kept track of her premenstrual symptoms in a diary.
meanings.sent3: The premenstrual cravings for chocolate were irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The premenstrual tension in the house was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The premenstrual fatigue made her want to sleep all day.
